dialogues.text: Grandma -

dialogues.speaker: ELLE
dialogues.text: Go on in, I'll be right there. Sage starts up the stairs as Elle peels off to talk to th protestor.

dialogues.speaker: ELLE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: What the hell’s wrong with you? Why are you out here terrorizing these young women? You need help, you know that? And this is a really unhealthy image for this little girl to be seeing.  43 71

dialogues.speaker: PROTESTOR
dialogues.text: Back off, Grandma slut!

dialogues.speaker: ELLE
dialogues.text: You should expand your vocabulary a little - Look, why don’t we talk like two human beings -

dialogues.speaker: HELL
dialogues.text: Elle swallows her anger.

dialogues.speaker: ELLE
dialogues.text: You hope I get cancer? Listen, bitch. If you weren't with this little girl, I’d take that sign and ram it where the sun doesn’t shine. Elle leans over to talk to the little girl.

dialogues.speaker: ELLE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Listen, sweetheart, there’s a larger world out there, and it doesn’t have to be filled with hatred and narrow-mindedness - The little girl rears back and PUNCHES ELLE IN THE EYE. T wooden beads that were wound around her fist go flying everywhere.

dialogues.speaker: ELLE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: oww!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Elle and Sage approach the front desk. They look at the clock. It reads 6:01.

dialogues.speaker: ELLE
dialogues.text: She has an appointment at 5:45. Sage Warren. We got delayed. Elle’s eye is bruised and red.

dialogues.speaker: SAGE
dialogues.text: My grandmother needs to be looked at.

dialogues.speaker: RECEPTIONIST
dialogues.text: What happened to you?  72

dialogues.speaker: ELLE
dialogues.text: I was slugged by The Bad Seed. I'm fine. It’s nothing.

dialogues.speaker: MOMENTS LATER
dialogues.text: They are sitting in the waiting room. Elle is holding an ice pack to her eye. A doctor comes out.

dialogues.speaker: DOCTOR
dialogues.text: Sage?

dialogues.speaker: SAGE
dialogues.text: Yes?

dialogues.speaker: DOCTOR
dialogues.text: I’m Dr. Ng. I heard there was some drama outside. Is your grandmother doing alright?

dialogues.speaker: ELLE
dialogues.text: Her grandmother is doing fine. Her grandmother isn’t unconscious or anything.

dialogues.speaker: DOCTOR
dialogues.text: (to Elle) Got it. So, I’d like to take a look at you.

dialogues.speaker: ELLE
dialogues.text: The nurse already did.

dialogues.speaker: DOCTOR
dialogues.text: I know, I’d like to look at you as well.

dialogues.speaker: SAGE
dialogues.text: Can I come?

dialogues.speaker: DOCTOR
dialogues.text: Sage, we're going to have you talk to our counselor for a little bit, just to go over everything.

dialogues.speaker: SAGE
dialogues.text: Well can my Grandmother come with me?  73

dialogues.speaker: DOCTOR
dialogues.text: It’s supposed to be private, to make sure you’re fully comfortable and it’s your decision.

dialogues.speaker: ELLE
dialogues.text: Whose decision would it be?

dialogues.speaker: DOCTOR
dialogues.text: It’s just to make sure she’s not feeling any outside pressure or any fear about the procedure. Our counselor is very well-trained and sensitive.

dialogues.speaker: ELLE
dialogues.text: Glad to hear it, but I’m gonna be there. This is my granddaughter.

dialogues.speaker: SAGE
dialogues.text: Okay. It’s okay, Grandma.

dialogues.speaker: ELLE
dialogues.text: Sage. I’m here.

dialogues.speaker: SAGE
dialogues.text: I know. But it’s okay. I’11 be okay. Sage takes her grandmother’s hand and squeezes it.

dialogues.speaker: SAGE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Thanks.

dialogues.speaker: ELLE
dialogues.text: Umm... For a moment, Elle’s eyes tear up.

dialogues.speaker: ELLE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Okay. Alright. I/’11 be right out here. If you need anything. And if anyone’s giving you any shit. They have to deal with me. Sage nods.

dialogues.speaker: NURSE
dialogues.text: Sage? Sage lets go of Elle’s hand. NURSE (CONT’D) You want to follow me please?  44 74 Sage nods and follows her out of the waiting room.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Elle sits on an examining table. The Doctor is shining a light in first one, then the other, of Elle’s eyes.

dialogues.speaker: DOCTOR
dialogues.text: You feeling any dizziness?

dialogues.speaker: ELLE
dialogues.text: I see a bright light in one eye, then the other eye.

dialogues.speaker: DOCTOR
dialogues.text: Ha-ha. No dizziness? Nausea?

dialogues.speaker: ELLE
dialogues.text: I told you I was fine. It wasn’t Mike Tyson. It was a little girl. With a nasty right hook. Take care of my granddaughter. You take care of her.

dialogues.speaker: DOCTOR
dialogues.text: I will.

dialogues.speaker: ELLE
dialogues.text: You better. If you hurt her, I’m going to come after you. I’m not kidding.

dialogues.speaker: DOCTOR
dialogues.text: I’m not going to hurt her.

dialogues.speaker: ELLE
dialogues.text: You're going to do a D and C?

dialogues.speaker: DOCTOR
dialogues.text: We don’t do curettage at this stage of pregnancy. Not at this clinic.

dialogues.speaker: ELLE
dialogues.text: What do you do?

dialogues.speaker: DOCTOR
dialogues.text: We do vacuum aspiration.

dialogues.speaker: ELLE
dialogues.text: Okay.  45

dialogues.speaker: DOCTOR
dialogues.text: It causes less trauma to the uterus.

dialogues.speaker: ELLE
dialogues.text: Okay. (pause) Guess it’s not the dark ages anymore.

dialogues.speaker: DOCTOR
dialogues.text: No.

dialogues.speaker: ELLE
dialogues.text: How much is it going to hurt her?

dialogues.speaker: DOCTOR
dialogues.text: It’ll be a bit uncomfortable. She may cramp a fair amount afterwards. But the procedure shouldn’t hurt.

dialogues.speaker: ELLE
dialogues.text: -.-Mine hurt. (beat) Mine hurt. It was a nightmare.

dialogues.speaker: DOCTOR
dialogues.text: Well...like you said. This isn’t the dark ages. Not here at least. Okay, I’m going to take you to the Well Woman waiting room.

dialogues.speaker: ELLE
dialogues.text: Catchy name.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Elle is staring at a bland watercolor print. She looks up as Judy comes into the waiting room.

dialogues.speaker: ELLE
dialogues.text: What are you doing here?

dialogues.speaker: JUDY
dialogues.text: I cancelled some things. 75 45 Judy's iphone buzzes. She looks at it, puts it back in he purse.

dialogues.speaker: JUDY, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: She okay?  76

dialogues.speaker: ELLE
dialogues.text: She went in about twenty minutes ago.

dialogues.speaker: JUDY
dialogues.text: What happened to your eye?

dialogues.speaker: ELLE
dialogues.text: The usual. Judy stands there, radiating discomfort.

dialogues.speaker: JUDY
dialogues.text: God. (pause) You want a coffee? I can get us a coffee.

dialogues.speaker: ELLE
dialogues.text: I'm alright.

dialogues.speaker: JUDY
dialogues.text: Right. Don’t really need any more caffeine myself. Judy looks at her watch. Sits.

dialogues.speaker: JUDY, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: How is she? (pause) Scared?

dialogues.speaker: ELLE
dialogues.text: Sure. They wait.

dialogues.speaker: JUDY
dialogues.text: Talk about a feeling of powerlessness. (pause) Kids. Elle nods.

dialogues.speaker: JUDY, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: I miss her. I miss Mama Vi. Elle looks at her.

dialogues.speaker: JUDY, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: ..-Wish I could talk with her about this.  77

dialogues.speaker: ELLE
dialogues.text: She'd have a thing or two to say.

dialogues.speaker: JUDY
dialogues.text: I'd like to ask her...what I did wrong.

dialogues.speaker: ELLE
dialogues.text: Who says you did something wrong?

dialogues.speaker: JUDY
dialogues.text: Well, we’re here, aren’t we?

dialogues.speaker: ELLE
dialogues.text: (pause) Better than if we weren’t here. Judy nods. They look up as Sage is escorted into the waiting room by nurse. Sage is walking a little unsteadily. She halts when she sees her mother.

dialogues.speaker: JUDY
dialogues.text: Hi, sweetheart.

dialogues.speaker: SAGE
dialogues.text: .»»-Hi. I thought -

dialogues.speaker: JUDY
dialogues.text: I cancelled some stuff.

dialogues.speaker: SAGE
dialogues.text: Sorry.

dialogues.speaker: JUDY
dialogues.text: No...no. I wanted to be here. You just...caught me by surprise. Elle gets up.

dialogues.speaker: ELLE
dialogues.text: Are you okay? Sage nods.

dialogues.speaker: NURSE
dialogues.text: She did great. (to Sage) Okay, we’ll see you in two weeks. (MORE )

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Remember to take your temperature every day, and call us if it goes above 100.4.

dialogues.speaker: SAGE
dialogues.text: Okay.

dialogues.speaker: NURSE
dialogues.text: We have a nurse available 24 hours a day, in case there’s anything out of the ordinary.

dialogues.speaker: JUDY
dialogues.text: Excellent.

dialogues.speaker: NURSE
dialogues.text: So one of you is driving Sage home?

dialogues.speaker: JUDY
dialogues.text: Iam. I’m her mother.

dialogues.speaker: NURSE
dialogues.text: Good. You can pull the car around. Jill and Wendy are gone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Elle helps Sage down the stairs. The Protestor daughter are gone.

dialogues.speaker: ELLE
dialogues.text: I wonder if it was Jill or Wendy who slugged me. It felt like a Wendy. Sage winces. Elle nods. forehead.

dialogues.speaker: SAGE
dialogues.text: I’m cramping.

dialogues.speaker: ELLE
dialogues.text: Bad?

dialogues.speaker: SAGE
dialogues.text: They said it’s normal. She puts the back of her hand up to

dialogues.speaker: ELLE
dialogues.text: You doing okay? and her Sage’s 78 46

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -..-I’m...a bit overwhelmed. But... glad it’s over. Glad it’s done. Some tears come to Sage’s eyes.

dialogues.speaker: SAGE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Shit - I’m crying again.

dialogues.speaker: ELLE
dialogues.text: Go ahead. Go ahead. (pause) If you don’t cry about this...what the hell are you gonna cry about? Elle strokes Sage’s hair for a moment. Sage takes a deep breath. Stops crying.

dialogues.speaker: SAGE
dialogues.text: Here she comes. Judy pulls up towards them in her BMW. Judy gets out of the car.

dialogues.speaker: JUDY
dialogues.text: Okay, let’s get you home. Sage looks at her mother.

dialogues.speaker: SAGE
dialogues.text: You were mean to me earlier.

dialogues.speaker: JUDY
dialogues.text: ...I know.

dialogues.speaker: SAGE
dialogues.text: I didn’t do this - I didn’t do anything to try and ruin your life.

dialogues.speaker: JUDY
dialogues.text: I know.

dialogues.speaker: SAGE
dialogues.text: I’m not perfect, okay? We’re not all perfect! And you’re not either! You’re not perfect!

dialogues.speaker: JUDY
dialogues.text: I’m aware of that. I am very aware of it. 79

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So don’t be such an asshole to me!

dialogues.speaker: JUDY
dialogues.text: (pause) I‘ll try. I will. (beat) And you stop seeing that little creep.

dialogues.speaker: SAGE
dialogues.text: Cam? He makes me puke. I/’11 never talk to him again.

dialogues.speaker: JUDY
dialogues.text: That’s a relief.

dialogues.speaker: SAGE
dialogues.text: Grandma beat the shit out of him. Judy laughs.

dialogues.speaker: ELLE
dialogues.text: I did. She’s not kidding.

dialogues.speaker: JUDY
dialogues.text: Oh. (pause) Wish I’d seen that. (to Elle) You need a ride?

dialogues.speaker: ELLE
dialogues.text: No, you should get her home. I’11 call a cab. Sage turns and HUGS Elle.

dialogues.speaker: SAGE
dialogues.text: Thanks Grandma. Then Sage gets in the car.

dialogues.speaker: JUDY
dialogues.text: I guess I should thank you. (pause) She's right. I’m just...I get so angry. I have so much anger. I don’t know where it comes from.

dialogues.speaker: ELLE
dialogues.text: You don’t?  47 48 81

dialogues.speaker: JUDY
dialogues.text: Well...you gave me good teeth too.

dialogues.speaker: ELLE
dialogues.text: Take care of them, or you’1ll lose them. (pause) Listen, I’m gonna need to borrow some money to fix my car. I can pay you back in a couple months.

dialogues.speaker: JUDY
dialogues.text: Okay. Guess I’m the bank of Judy.

dialogues.speaker: ELLE
dialogues.text: Guess so. Judy goes to the car.

dialogues.speaker: ELLE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: I'd like to come check on her. Tomorrow.

dialogues.speaker: JUDY
dialogues.text: Come by. (pause) Stay for dinner, if you want. I'’11 order pizza. Judy gets in her car.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The side of the highway. A tow-truck driver hooks up Elle’s car. Elle watches as he hoists the car’s front end.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A mechanic talks to Elle.

dialogues.speaker: MECHANIC
dialogues.text: To replace the camshaft will be expensive.

dialogues.speaker: ELLE
dialogues.text: Hunh.  49 82

dialogues.speaker: MECHANIC
dialogues.text: You been putting oil in it regularly? Elle doesn't bother answering.

dialogues.speaker: MECHANIC, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: (re her face) You had that black eye checked out? You bang your head on the steering wheel?

dialogues.speaker: ELLE
dialogues.text: Sure. Elle goes to the window and looks out.

dialogues.speaker: MECHANIC
dialogues.text: Got anyone?

dialogues.speaker: ELLE
dialogues.text: What? She looks at him.

dialogues.speaker: MECHANIC
dialogues.text: You got anyone? To pick you up?

dialogues.speaker: ELLE
dialogues.text: No.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Elle sits in the back of a cab, her arms crossed. By her feet is the bag of first editions she brought to the Bono cafe. She looks down at her arm, not the one where she got the tattoo. She rolls up her sleeve. There is a flower tattooed there. A Violet. Her eyes water up. She kisses the Violet tattoo.

dialogues.speaker: ELLE
dialogues.text: (murmurs ) Always. You know that. You know that, Vi. Darling. Always. Always and always... (MORE )

dialogues.speaker: ELLE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: (beat) Yes. You're right. I’m crazy. I am. You never seemed to mind. She exhales, breathing out emotion.

dialogues.speaker: ELLE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Okay. Alright. I know... I know... She knocks on the cab partition.

dialogues.speaker: ELLE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: I want to go to a different address. (pause) Excuse me. I want to go toa different address.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The cab pulls up on a residential street.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Elle looks out the window.

dialogues.speaker: ELLE
dialogues.text: Wait here for me, please.

dialogues.speaker: CABBIE
dialogues.text: You have to pay me now.

dialogues.speaker: ELLE
dialogues.text: Alright. But wait, okay?

dialogues.speaker: CABBIE
dialogues.text: How long?

dialogues.speaker: ELLE
dialogues.text: I don’t know. Five minutes.

dialogues.speaker: CABBIE
dialogues.text: Okay.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Elle goes up some stairs, approaches an apartment door. There are lights on inside, although Elle can’t see in through the curtains.  53 She rings the doorbell. Now she can hear a few voices. She steps back as the door opens, and Olivia is standing there.

dialogues.speaker: OLIVIA
dialogues.text: (surprised) Elle -

dialogues.speaker: ELLE
dialogues.text: Hi.

dialogues.speaker: OLIVIA
dialogues.text: What happened to you?

dialogues.speaker: ELLE
dialogues.text: Nothing. Some little girl punched me.

dialogues.speaker: OLIVIA
dialogues.text: What?

dialogues.speaker: ELLE
dialogues.text: It was a karma boomerang. Anyway, I’m fine.

dialogues.speaker: OLIVIA
dialogues.text: Well come in.

dialogues.speaker: ELLE
dialogues.text: No, you have company.

dialogues.speaker: OLIVIA
dialogues.text: Come in, let’s get some ice.

dialogues.speaker: ELLE
dialogues.text: It’s okay. I don’t need ice.

dialogues.speaker: OLIVIA
dialogues.text: Come in. Please. Olivia goes into her apartment. After a beat, Elle follows her in.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Olivia goes towards the kitchen. There is a couple in their fifties inside. 84 53  85 They are hippy-ish looking.

dialogues.speaker: OLIVIA
dialogues.text: Elle, these are my parents, Mike and Francesca. Mom, Dad, this is Elle.

dialogues.speaker: ELLE
dialogues.text: (under her breath) Jesus.

dialogues.speaker: FRANCESCA
dialogues.text: Hello.

dialogues.speaker: ELLE
dialogues.text: (beat) Hi, I’m...I’m a friend of your daughter.

dialogues.speaker: MIKE
dialogues.text: (strained) We've heard a lot about you.

dialogues.speaker: FRANCESCA
dialogues.text: I enjoy your poetry.

dialogues.speaker: ELLE
dialogues.text: You do. Thank you.

dialogues.speaker: FRANCESCA
dialogues.text: I read it when I was in college.

dialogues.speaker: ELLE
dialogues.text: Of course.

dialogues.speaker: FRANCESCA
dialogues.text: I was a Women’s Studies major.

dialogues.speaker: ELLE
dialogues.text: (beat) Congratulations.

dialogues.speaker: FRANCESCA
dialogues.text: “Dragonfly” was one of my favorite poems. “You bite my wings, attack me, mid-flight...evolution’s knife... held to my throat..."

dialogues.speaker: ELLE
dialogues.text: ...Yes, that’s the one that gets anthologized. Not my favorite, honestly. On a technical level.  86

dialogues.speaker: FRANCESCA
dialogues.text: How come you stopped writing?

dialogues.speaker: ELLE
dialogues.text: Well...cause people stopped reading. Olivia comes back with a bag of ice.

dialogues.speaker: OLIVIA
dialogues.text: Here. Olivia puts some ice on Elle’s eye. Elle takes it from he

dialogues.speaker: ELLE
dialogues.text: Thank you. It’s really...I already put ice on it. But thank you. Elle steps back.

dialogues.speaker: ELLE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: I’m going to - I’m going to give you all your privacy. I have a cab waiting for me. Sorry to intrude, I just - I came by to give you these. She gives Olivia the bag she brought. Olivia looks. The first edition books are inside it.

dialogues.speaker: ELLE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: They're first editions.

dialogues.speaker: OLIVIA
dialogues.text: I know what they are.

dialogues.speaker: ELLE
dialogues.text: Of course. Well, goodbye. Pleasure to meet you. Elle turns and leaves. 54 EXT. LANDING BY OLIVIA’S APARTMENT - NIGHT 54 Olivia comes out onto the landing by the door.

dialogues.speaker: OLIVIA
dialogues.text: Elle -

dialogues.speaker: ELLE
dialogues.text: Yeah.  55 87

dialogues.speaker: OLIVIA
dialogues.text: Where are you going?

dialogues.speaker: ELLE
dialogues.text: Home.

dialogues.speaker: OLIVIA
dialogues.text: So, you just came here for that - just to give me some books.

dialogues.speaker: ELLE
dialogues.text: No, no, that’s not all I came for... Elle looks at Olivia.

dialogues.speaker: ELLE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Course it meant something to me. I loved being in love with you. ...I never thought I’d feel that way again. (pause) You have a wonderful life ahead of you. And that’s what I want for you...I want you to have what I had. (beat) It’s been a long day. I'd kind of like to get home and do some writing. You'd better go back in and see if your parents need some smelling salts or something. Olivia laughs. Elle smiles at her. Elle steps forward and kisses her. They kiss.

dialogues.speaker: ELLE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Okay, bye.

dialogues.speaker: OLIVIA
dialogues.text: Okay. Elle turns and goes. EXT. STREET BY OLIVIA’S BUILDING - NIGHT 55 Elle comes out onto the street. She looks for the cab. It is gone.

dialogues.speaker: ELLE
dialogues.text: Son of a bitch.  88 She laughs. She turns and starts walking off down the street. She walks into the distance, in and out of the streetlights... FADE TO BLACK.
